dlgPart.npc_text:
Bassar’s standing near a wall, watching a row of houses right outside the Slums. He gives you a quick look when you come closer and returns to his present occupation.
“You see that house over there?” he points at one of the houses. “Gotta be at least eight or nine Boatmen inside. That’s a lot of manpower...”

“Levir didn’t tell you? Your heist attracted too much attention. Sellswords have been gathering outside the Slums ever since the rumors broke out. I counted twenty three men yesterday. Could be over thirty today, which means they are about to strike.”
“If they are dumb enough to think that they have a chance, they are dumb enough to think that if they wait any longer, they will have to share the gold with too many people.”

“If they were a real mercenary company – campaign veterans trained to fight together, we’d have to throw everything we have at them. These rejects? They will learn why even the guards avoid the Slums the hard way.”

dlgAnsw.text: “So, what do you want me to do?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Good fighting men are hard to find. They are paid well and treated right, so they won’t be wandering around and looking for scores. Those that do are the ones who have trouble keeping a job.”

dlgAnsw.text: “So, what do you want me to do?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Take care of the Boatmen. They can do a lot of damage, if they strike when we’re distracted. We’ll lure the sellswords deeper into the Slums and leave the assassins to you and Aziz.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Two of us against eight or nine Boatmen?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Take care of the Boatmen. They can do a lot of damage, if they strike when we’re distracted. We’ll lure the sellswords deeper into the Slums and leave the assassins to you, Aziz, and Lucius.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Three of us against eight or nine Boatmen?”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“I can’t spare any of my men,” says Bassar, shaking his head. “I have the sellswords to deal with. Besides, it's your mess, so you have to do your part. It's only fair.
“So, if you're as clever as you think you are, you'll find a way. If not...”

dlgAnsw.text: “I thought we were in it together.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “We are, which is why I'm not sending you against the sellswords. It's your mess, <charname>, and if you think that my men will do all the work, while you're taking it easy, you better think again.”
“Then you'd better hurry up and buy whatever it is you need. I'd say you have about an hour before the sellswords attack.”
